questions.question: If something is bothering you, you should..

choices.answer: Wait & see if it resolves itself
Bring it up & work it out
Ignore it, to bring it up would be awkward
Get angry, they should KNOW what is bothering you

questions.question: "Mutual Respect" means..

choices.answer: Showing respect for everyone you meet
Letting people know when they aren't respectful
Giving respect & getting respect
Showing respect to those who deserve it

questions.question: You see a text from the person you hate the most on your friend's (or BF/GF's) phone.

choices.answer: Ask them about it if it upsets you
Go through their phone
Text the person you hate and call them out
Do nothing even if it upsets you

questions.question: How can your respect your friend's (or BF/GF's) space?

choices.answer: Only talking to them at school and not after school
Waiting until they text you first
Hanging out with them Mon-Fri but not on weekends
Not always being together, but always having their back

questions.question: An example of an unhealthy boundary is...

choices.answer: Hanging out with your friends WITHOUT your BF/GF sometimes
Participating in sports and hobbies that you like
Not having to share your social media passwords
Quitting orchestra because your bf/gf thinks it's dumb

questions.question: What is an example of verbal abuse?

choices.answer: "When you don't call me when you say you will, I feel angry"
"You shouldn't cheat on your homework, that's wrong"
"You made me really mad, I need some time to myself"
"You're embarrassing me, you're so stupid sometimes"

questions.question: What is a warning sign of an abusive relationship?

choices.answer: Your partner starts to isolate you and keep you from friends
Your partner won't hold your hand in the hallways
Your partner doesn't want to go to the school dance with you
Your partner doesn't snapchat you very often

questions.question: When you break up with someone..

choices.answer: Do it over phone call
Do it over text or DM, since that's  how you talk anyway
It should always be in person, unless you feel unsafe.
It doesn't matter how you do it

questions.question: You notice your friend is acting depressed and you see cuts on their arm. You should...

choices.answer: Tell them they need to stop or else you'll tell
Don't say anything, it might upset them
Tell an adult & get them help
Get one of your friends to confront them

questions.question: A sign of a healthy relationship is..

choices.answer: You can speak your mind in front of them
Your friends like them
You love them
You talk to them every day

questions.question: You really think your partner is cheating.

choices.answer: Go through their phone to find out if it's true
Ask your friends to keep an eye on them
Ask them & tell them about your concerns
Break up with them NOW

questions.question: If someone cheats on you..

choices.answer: they should apologize
You should look at how you can fix the relationship
You should ask them why and try to solve the problem
It is NEVER your fault.

questions.question: An example of physical abuse is...

choices.answer: Grabbing your face to make you look at them out of anger
Refusing to hold your hand when they're angry
Telling you to be quiet
Telling you you're stupid

questions.question: An example of emotional abuse is..

choices.answer: Telling you when they're upset
Saying they don't want to go to the school dance
Calling you names & yelling at you
Not helping you with your homework

questions.question: If your partner asks for your social media passwords..

choices.answer: You should not give them, that is a violation of privacy
You should give them if you trust your partner
You should report them to an adult
You should break up with them

questions.question: If you don't trust your friend, you should..

choices.answer: Ignore it, it's not a big deal
Reconsider your friendship
Stay friends but don't hang out with them
Tell them they're a liar

questions.question: Can someone who hurts you or is abusive change?

choices.answer: Definitely not
Absolutely, abuse is a once time mistake
Depends
Maybe, but it would require professional help

questions.question: ____% of teens has been or is in an abusive relationship
___% of teens have been physically abused by a boyfriend/girlfriend
___% of teens who are in an abusive relationship don't tell anyone about it
